sentence.Network_en: Later, Simpson arrogantly claimed: "We won't lose another game."
sentence.Network_cn: 稍后，辛普森傲慢地宣称：“我们不会再输了。”

sentence.Network_en: The consular porter strode arrogantly ahead with his light swinging.
sentence.Network_cn: 领事馆的门房提着摇来晃去的灯,在前面大摇大摆地走着.

sentence.Network_en: It made his great nose protrude more arrogantly.
sentence.Network_cn: 这就使得他的大鼻子更加傲慢地翘起来.

arrogant 傲慢的arrogantly 自大地arrogate to 硬性归于
Whether remembered I said arrogantly ., 是否记得莪骄傲地说.
They pour forth words , they speak arrogantly ; All who do wickedness vaunt themselves ., 他们絮絮叨叨 , 说傲慢的话 ． 一切作孽的人 , 都自己夸张.

To behave arrogantly ., 行为傲慢地.
" Everton are a big club , not a small one which Benitez arrogantly said , " he said .“埃弗顿是一家大俱乐部，不是贝尼特斯胡说的小俱乐部。”他说道。

entry.def: Someone who is arrogant behaves in a proud, unpleasant way towards other people because they believe that they are more important than others.

example.tran: 那话听起来很嚣张，是不是？

sentences.sentence: "in the old days she had been harsh and stiff ; afraid of her husband and yet arrogantly proud that she had a husband strong and fierce enough to make her afraid"
